app module¶

Sales and Wishlist Management Service

This Flask application provides a RESTful API for managing sales, wishlists, notifications, and recommendations for an e-commerce platform. It supports user interactions such as purchasing goods, managing wishlists, receiving notifications, and viewing product recommendations.

Features: - Display available goods with stock information (Admin view). - Retrieve detailed information about goods. - Purchase goods with wallet balance validation. - Manage wishlists (add, remove, view, and check items). - Get personalized product recommendations. - Notify users of goods about to expire in their wishlist. - View purchase history (customer-specific and admin-only). - Receive notifications for wishlist items.

Modules: - Flask: Core framework for the application. - Flask-JWT-Extended: For token-based authentication. - SQLAlchemy: ORM for database interactions. - Marshmallow: Input validation and serialization. - Bleach: Input sanitization to prevent XSS attacks.

opts: SchemaOpts = <marshmallow.schema.SchemaOpts object>¶
app.add_expiry_notification()[source]¶

Creates notifications for goods about to expire in the customer’s wishlist.

This function is executed periodically to notify customers about expiring goods.

app.add_to_wishlist()[source]¶

Adds an item to the customer’s wishlist.

Parameters:

None (data is provided in the request body)

Returns:

JSON response confirming addition or an error message if the item already exists.

Return type:

Response

app.display_available_goods()[source]¶

Displays all goods with stock information.

Returns:

JSON response with available goods. Admins see stock and price details.

Return type:

Response

app.get_all_purchase_histories()[source]¶

Retrieves all purchase histories.

Admin-only endpoint.

Returns:

JSON response with a list of all sales, including customer, product, and purchase details.

Return type:

Response

app.get_good_details(good_id)[source]¶

Retrieves detailed information about a specific good.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – ID of the good to retrieve.

Returns:

JSON response with good details. Admins see full details, while users see limited details.

Return type:

Response

app.get_notifications()[source]¶

Retrieves all notifications for the authenticated customer.

Returns:

JSON response with a list of notifications, including type, message, and timestamps.

Return type:

Response

app.get_purchase_history()[source]¶

Retrieves purchase history for the authenticated customer.

Returns:

JSON response with a list of purchase history.

Response

app.get_recommendations()[source]¶

Provides personalized product recommendations for the customer.

Returns:

JSON response with a list of recommended goods based on purchase patterns.

Checks if a specific good is in the customer’s wishlist.

Parameters:

good_id (int) – ID of the good to check.

Returns:

JSON response with in_wishlist: True if the item exists, or in_wishlist: False if it does not.

Return type:

Response

Returns:
